clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of ariboflavinosis vitamin B2 deficiency

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Riboflavin or vitamin B2 is an easily absorbed water soluble micronutrient with a key role in maintaining human health Like the other B vitamins it supports energy production by aiding in the metabolising of fats carbohydrates and proteins Vitamin B2 is also required for red blood cell formation and respiration antibody production and for regulating human growth and reproduction It is essential for healthy skin nails hair growth and general good health including regulating thyroid activity Riboflavin also helps in the prevention or treatment of many types of eye disorders including some cases of cataracts

incompatibilities.description: Riboflavin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Porfimer sodium
Riboflavin may increase the photosensitizing activities of Verteporfin
The excretion of Citrulline can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cefotiam can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Tenofovir disoproxil can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Indomethacin can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Aminohippuric acid can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Grepafloxacin can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cidofovir can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Trifluridine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Zidovudine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cimetidine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cefdinir can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cephalexin can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Stavudine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Fluorescein can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Lamivudine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Adefovir dipivoxil can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Alprostadil can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Acyclovir can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Ranitidine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Didanosine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Dinoprostone can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Zalcitabine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Levofloxacin can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Captopril can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cefazolin can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Ceftizoxime can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cefacetrile can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Ceftibuten can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Tazobactam can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cyclic adenosine monophosphate can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Glutaric Acid can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Taurocholic acid can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Ellagic acid can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Cefaloridine can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Silibinin can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Tenofovir alafenamide can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The excretion of Edaravone can be decreased when combined with Riboflavin
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Tretinoin is combined with Riboflavin
